header.title: Your Project - getting started with using Forrest
header.subtitle: Overview

section.title: Goal
section.p: You have your own project and you want to use Forrest to build the project documentation.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The forrestbot will automatically build and publish your documentation on a regular basis. This document provides a concise overview. See The ForrestBot for details and understand Our Contract.

(Building the documentation for the actual Forrest project is a separate issue. Use ./build.sh clean docs ... that will provide overview documentation about how Forrest operates and how you can help to improve it.)

section.title: Establish project source directory
section.p: The directory that contains our XML instances.
Our XML instance documents are at $SRC_DOC/content/xdocs

section.title: Establish project configuration
section.p: cp $FORREST_HOME/forrestbot.conf.xml $PROJECT_HOME/yourproject.conf.xml and edit it to replace the <project> definitions with our own, i.e.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: Some enhancements to our local forrestbot would be ...

ul.li: Add our own skin at $SRC_DOC/skins/yourproject by copying one of the skins from $FORREST_HOME/src/resources/skins (use basic or forrest-site)
Configure another <project> to conduct a secure copy to our public website.
Get it to send us email about forrestbot activities.

section.title: Other methods
section.p: The recent contribution of acorn (a simple Ant script that bootstraps Forrest for a new project. See email discussion: http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=forrest-dev&m=102958410525990
